column5: Wish we were fishing bro, but we got to see the little sister off to her happy day of wedding bliss.  Maybe we can do a grumpy old man thing???????????????????? Get me to the church on time,,,,,,,Not,mudder would kill us.HAHAHAHAHA
Congrats Brian!!  That's an awesome fish man.  I have an offer to fish simcoe this friday and you just made it all the better.  Cheers, ben.
Beauty Smallie, A real HOG! Congrats on you PB
Youse done real good...tells yer mother...congrats lad...
Another nice simcoe smallie, awesome!

Well a big congrats on the PB Brian!!! Like Mark said 5 of those and it's party time.. It was nice to run into you while I was scouting out some areas. Hope the weatherman's good to us at The Open. See you there.   Marcel
very nice! Thanks for sharing it with us!

Brian....wow!!! What an amazing report.  6 pounder...congrats on the new PB!  When I have a big fish on, I do the same thing you did...talk to myself...LOL.  I say "keep the tip up....don't horse it.....know which direction the fish is going....damn...keep that tip up!!!"
A thing of beauty for sure!
....Sweet fish Brian. That elusive six lb mark has still eluded me. Plenty of fives but no cigar as they say.

As the title says,I finally got my personal best and now belong to the six pound club  Left the Barrie Marina 7am along. Since the BPS touneys location has been changed I thought I would hit the eastside. The winds were out of the west and light so I figured it was a good time to head over that way. Just as I get past BBP,there was left over south rollers still out there,but was still managable to get across.Headed to a couple of humps I have fished before. Took a bit to find them as the coordinates were on my old gps that went in the drink a couple years back. Once I found them I started to work a tube with 1/2 onuce jig and aswell as a dropshot. This boat approaches and Im thinking to myself,what does this head want. As he gets closer ,he says hows it going Brian,I say who you? Marcal,hey dude what up.Marcel is MART,from the board here.    After a chat and some conversing on spots,we both went on our way.Nice to see you again Marcel.  Ok down to fishing again. Head up to Georgina Island.Worked a few drop off and rock piles but fish were small.      After an hour of throwing the tube I decided to hit an area that works for me and there again I found small fish.      Thinking that with the warmer then norm temps,maybe the fish are still in thier summer pattern   .I had been very hesitant to use my lucky craft lure, but went with it and thats when my day was made. Moved in to 10 fow and started to chuck the craft. Wham fish on.Nice 3 pound chunk,next cast. I start to jerk it back to the boat, I can see the lure and this black thing moving behind it. Stop,twitch and bam,fish on. It took like seemed to be 10 minutes to get this fish to the boat. I knew it was big and didnt want to horse it in. 1 jump 2 jumps and I knew I had a fish of a life time on.So with me muddering to myself ,easy easy,take your time,I get the fish to the boat,in the net and YES,it a tank.My PB and I know belong to the 6 pound club. Awesome just awesome. I may not be smiling,but I was shaking.LOL      On my way back in I came a cross a herum of cormarands. There had to be over 500 of them. The vid isnt the best but I did get close enough to them to smell thier stench.PHEW.  http://smg.photobucket.com/albums/v731/mis...allies07010.flv  Thanks for reading
Way to go Brian!  Funny I was just about to PM you to see how you did! Seems like they are still in summer patterns but this weather this week might just change that.  D
Congrats on the PB Brian! Beauty Smallie!
Nice job Brian, that 6 pound mark has been impossible for me to break, been close a lot but no cegar!
Wow, great looking fish!  Congrats!
That's awesome Brian. WTG Bud!!!
Congrats on your big fat hog Brian.
awesome fish there,congrats on your pb
gee... all you guys out fishing with no one to keep the second seat warm and dry..    nice fish......
Great stuff Brian !! So big it even woke Rattletrap up ! LOL
WOW, WTG...

Terry, I wasnt sure if I would get out this weekend.With the crap weather the last 2 days I wasnt going to head out if it was crap again today.When I woke up and seen "A" star .I said what the hell.  You know yer always welcome.  Thanks guys for the replies.  Can anyone tell me whats the best way to cook a PB?
Congrats on the PB and judging by the dark colours I would say that fish has been staying pretty shallow! Looks like its gonna be a great Tournament with alot of big weights!
LOL Brian, sushi! eat it raw!
Wow, nice fish dude! Congrats on your PB! What was the length on this fish?
Johnny.I was fishing in 10-14 fow on a rock/pebble with a  weedline.Im thinking the weeds had something to do with the colour.  Thanks
Beauty of a fish, Brian! You're starting to get them dialed in on that lake...  Good Fishing, Justin
Didnt measure Dano.I just put it on the scale and it jumped from 5.9 up to 6.3 then settled on 6.16.
Nice smallies Brian-just think-4 more like that and you breaki the Canadian record!
Thanks again guys. Mark, I was thinking about that.LOL Man those fall smallies are a blast. Sure glad I kept the boat out.
Justin, Im just fishing from what I have been learning from the ones that do it best. They seem to know what thier talking about.  Thanks Justin.
WTG brian, you seem to spend tons of time on the water and you've earned the 6lbr. congrats, darcy

Congrats on the PB Smallie!  Nice fish.  Just shows you when you need that something extra its time to pull out your 'lucky' lure!  Now if only I could persuade my wife to let me buy some of those $$$ luckycrafts!  007
Awesome Smallie Brian !!!!!!!   right on man  ,great looking fish,congrats on your new PB...cheers
nice fish there brother see you on the weekend  rob
